title: Random crashes occur during manual logout

milestone.title: 1.27.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
### This release will be used for wide internal dogfooding 

Mobile dev team priorities In priority order:

**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 1.26 cycle**

**2. Select which accounts to share with each Community's control node**
- Designs should be ready for review and dev feedback by 18th September

**3. Settings home screen**
- the settings home screen only

**4. Fix bugs, both functional and UX fit-and-finish defects.**  

- specifically focus on bugs related to the Communities functionality, when a community is utilizing all the community admin functionality available in Status Desktop

- any remaining UX quality defects

- ensure all community token gating related functionality is working

body:
Unfortunately there are no clear steps of how to reproduce the crash. Last time I have reproduced it following below steps in the [PR](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/18140#issuecomment-1857859652). Maybe something will be clear based on attached logs.  cc @vitvly 


**Steps:** 

1. Recover User A on Device 1 and Device 2. Set different passwords and Enable biometrics for both devices during recovery (not sure if it is important step)
2. Sync Devices
3. Change profile picture on Device 1, add some community on Device 2 (also not sure if this step is important)
4. Perform manual logout on devices
5. See if app has not crashed on logout

**Actual result:** sometimes (both IOS and Android) crash on manual logout. 

[logcat_151223.log.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13685497/logcat_151223.log.zip)

[Status-debug-logs (90).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13685499/Status-debug-logs.90.zip)

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/97245802/fef2f67f-90fa-42df-98c4-b92ba5890ffb



### Additional Information

- Status version: nightly 
- Operating System: Android, iOS

Panic found by @qfrank in the above logs. 


```
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x20 pc=0x77715d63c0]
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : 
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : goroutine 455 [running]:
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : github.com/status-im/status-go/wakuv2.(*Waku).broadcast(0x40001c0f00)
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : 	github.com/status-im/status-go/wakuv2/waku.go:1060 +0x40
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : created by github.com/status-im/status-go/wakuv2.(*Waku).Start
12-15 14:53:58.687 14067     0 E Go      : 	github.com/status-im/status-go/wakuv2/waku.go:1270 +0x7c4
```
